snippet: The lack of an organized leadership in both the white establishment and the black community has raised questions about how effective both sides can be in ending the standoff.
abstract: Ferguson, Mo, Mayor James Knowles III describes frustration over officials' responses to fatal police shooting of unarmed black teenager Michael Brown; says tangle of leadership, in both the white establishment and the black community, has fueled chaos and raises questions about how effective both sides can be in bringing end to standoff and some lasting change of complicated issues of race, trust and policing.

byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and TANZINA VEGA
byline.contributor: Julie Bosman, John Eligon and Frances Robles contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The lack of an organized leadership in both the white establishment and the black community has raised questions about how effective both sides can be in ending the standoff.

headline.main: Chaos in Ferguson Is Fueled by Tangle of Leadership
headline.print_headline: Tangle of Leadership Helps Fuel Chaos in Ferguson
